org.jfree.chart

Interface RenderingSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferedImageRenderingSource, ChartPanel, PolarChartPanel

    public interface RenderingSource
    A RenderingSource is an object that calls the draw(...) method in the JFreeChart class. An example is the ChartPanel class.
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Graphics2D createGraphics2D()
      Returns a graphics context that a renderer can use to calculate selection bounds.
      DatasetSelectionState getSelectionState(Dataset dataset)
      Returns the selection state, if any, that this source is maintaining for the specified dataset.
      void putSelectionState(Dataset dataset, DatasetSelectionState state)
      Stores the selection state that is associated with the specified dataset for this rendering source.

    • Method Detail

      • createGraphics2D

        java.awt.Graphics2D createGraphics2D()
        Returns a graphics context that a renderer can use to calculate selection bounds.
        Returns:
        A graphics context.

      • getSelectionState

        DatasetSelectionState getSelectionState(Dataset dataset)
        Returns the selection state, if any, that this source is maintaining for the specified dataset.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset (null not permitted).
        Returns:
        The selection state (possibly null).

      • putSelectionState

        void putSelectionState(Dataset dataset,
                       DatasetSelectionState state)
        Stores the selection state that is associated with the specified dataset for this rendering source. If two rendering sources are displaying the same dataset, ideally they should have separate selection states.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset (null not permitted).
        state - the state (null permitted).
